Their event manager, Brandon Thompson, took care of every detail and worked with us to make sure we stayed within our budget.  No one wants to be in charge of planning their high school reunion, but I would absolutely do it again if I could do it at Olive or Twist and work with Brandon and his team.  Everything was awesome!

Came here before a show at the Cabaret with a friend for happy hour : ) We had a $10 for $20 coupon, but didn't end up using it since the specials were enough for us (didn't want to get too stuffed before going to see a show)!  We each started off with martinis - since they have sooo many delicious sounding drinks, woman behind the bar was happy to recommend and help us decide. The ones we decided on, Espresso (for a nice kick before the show) and orange creamsicle martinis were great - and $2 off each for happy hour! For food, we went with nachos and the buffalo dip - dip was cute and served in a martini glass with tasty pita chips, and the nachos were decent, even if a little skimpy on the toppings (but I could just be overdemanding when it comes to nachos).   All in all, very pleasant experience right before going to the cabaret. Would love to go back sometime to try more of their drinks and food!

Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh! The atmosphere is great and the martini list is extensive. I've ordered the cake batter, caramel apple, and s'mores and haven't been disappointed in any so far. The buffalo chicken dip appetizer is what keeps us coming back! It is served cold in a martini glass with warm pita chips and is just amazing! I've ordered several dishes and haven't had a bad meal either!  The only thing that lacks sometimes is the service, especially on my last visit. We were standing at the hostess stand for a couple of minutes and no one came over. Finally a girl did but she just looked at us, got something, and walked away. Not even a "someone will be right with you". Then another girl came over and said "do you need a table?". I wanted to respond with "why would I be standing at a podium that says let us seat you", but I refrained. We were seated, it took several more minutes for our drink order to be taken and it was subpar service the rest of the night. Waiting, waiting, and more waiting.   Other than that, love the food, love the atmosphere and especially love the martinis!

We decided to stop by Olive or Twist on a recent Saturday night before a show. A friend was at a wedding upstairs and asked us to drop in to say hi. Apparently they host wedding receptions in the lounge area above the bar/restaurant.  I was hoping to get a quick meal and a drink before the show. When we arrived the bar was packed and we were told that they had no availability to sit in the restaurant section. But, little can deter me. I scoped out the tables by the bar and noticed a couple getting ready to pay. After making casual chit chat, they agreed to save their table for us. They paid and left while we ordered a drink at the bar. As soon as they got up the waitress put a reserved sign on the table, I assumed it was for us and sat down. Nope. She was trying to reserve it for an 8pm reservation. I thought this was the bar area which is seat yourself? Oh well, I told her we had to be out by 8 for a show anyway so it would work out fine. A few minutes later she came back and told us no, that won't work and we will have to find a place at the bar. Seriously? We are already sitting in the seat yourself tables, it was fine 2 minutes ago, we have to leave by 8, what's the issue? Rather annoyed we looked for seats and ways to inch ourselves into the already overly crowded bar when the waitress returned and said she will reserve another table that was leaving. Now, we have wasted 10 minutes of our already limited time before the show so, I asked what was the fastest thing on the menu. We ordered soup, salad and the buffalo chicken spread. The soup arrived first. I had the homemade chicken noodle. Warm, comfort food that hit the spot. Next was the pear salad with candied walnuts, blue cheese and strawberry vinagerette.  Again, super tasty. I could snack on the candied walnuts all day. Then the buffalo chicken spread. Presentation was great-in a martini glass. The pita chips were delic! But where was the chicken? I searched through the entire martini glass, not one shred or chunk of chicken. Being a buffalo chicken dip lover, I was sorely disappointed. As for the drinks, stick with the martinis as the wine was also a big disappointment.
Excellent food (especially the tomato basil soup- and I don't even like tomato soup).  Moderate service, nice atmosphere, though sometimes a bit too loud for conversation.

We came here to use the $10 for $20 deal. The server, Alex, was very nice and friendly. Our food kind of took a long time to come out, especially considering the fact that it was a salad and a turkey wrap. However, the food items were very tasty; my salad was really good - it was the candied walnut one, can't go wrong with those on it. The drink menu didn't seem to have prices for the martinis on it but we assumed they would be expensive so didn't get one, but if I come back it will be for a martini.

Nice service! But I still feel screwed. I use the "deal" so even though I was there for "happy hours " I could not get that deal because I used the deal with yelp. What that's not right! They got ya one way or another GRrr

We had our wedding reception here this weekend & it couldn't have gone any better! Thank you so much to Brandon and the event staff for making our wedding go so smoothly! I had multiple people say it was one of the best weddings they had been to, and that "all weddings should be like this." The cocktail-style reception allowed for a relaxed, party atmosphere, but there were plenty of seats and table-tops for our 100 guests. Brandon was also quick to respond to all of my emails and was incredibly knowledgeable & dead-on with his estimations as far as cost and the right amount of food for our guests. Thank you again, our wedding was perfect! Highly recommended!

Went here a couple weeks ago around 4 or 5 on Saturday before a game. It's a martini bar, but they can't make a cucumber martini? Also, worst lobster mac n cheese I've had in my life and I've had some bad ones. No discernible pieces of lobster and it tasted like bacon bits with a cup of salt dumped on top. I took a bite and asked for my bill. Might be good for a cheap beer before the game, but there are much better options for good food and booze in the area.

Visiting, found on yelp and a quasi recommend.  The Fri nite vibe was great.  Live guitarist, excellent.  Steak sandwich and salad was very good. 2x IPA Strongbow made my palate complete.  Bartenders attentive too..Well done.
Great time. Went over for drinks after James Taylor concert. Bar had a fun crowd

Wonderful place! My wife and I got married here. We needed a nice venue near our hotel to do the wedding and the reception -- and Olive Or Twist delivered. They served good food and great drinks.   Brandon Thompson, their Director of Sales & Events, was so  helpful and helped make the evening a joy.   If you're going to be in Pittsburgh, stop by this fine establishment. You'll have a great time.

Olive or Twist is the historic site of my VERY FIRST MARTINI when I turned 21, many years ago.    It's been a long, happy union.  While Olive or Twist is NOT a five star restaurant, it gets 5 stars from me because I love it.  Its one of the few places I know of that has been CONSISTANTLY good.  for years!  The interior is warm and a little bit industrial.  The downstairs is the same as it has always been and it's still very nice.  The drinks are great although the first martini I ever had (a girl doesn't forget!  [well,this one didn't]) was a Pineapple Upside Down martini and I don't think they offer that anymore but they do have a very expansive martini menu.  I tried the chipotle martini and it was so excellent that when I took my first sip I sighed in a way my bf turned to me and sarcastically said, "Oh, you're going to be Yelping about that, aren't you?"  Then, I refused to let him even try it bc it was that good.  It was MINE.  I also had a cake batter martini which tasted great and came out looking so pretty I instagrammed a picture of it and immediately all my friends clicked like on it, and my one aunt commented I should drink less.  Whatever. She needs a martini.  The service was great.  Our waitress, Lauren, was really cool and very good at recommending the drinks--the chipotle martini was her recommendation, I would never had ordered that on my own.  We had the buffalo chicken dip which was served in a martini glass and it was really good.  My favorite thing on the menu there is the tomato basil bisque soup and it has been rocking my lunch hour for the past ten years.  It's delicious.  Its so good that Lauren and I actually high fived when she brought it out.  (true story.)  My bf had the chicken caprese wrap and said it was excellent, it was gone within minutes so that is a good sign.  I highly recommend this place for lunch, after dinner cocktails, or a date.  This is one of my favorite downtown lunch spots!

I have been here few times over the years but never ate here.  It's a great happy hour spot - have a drink or two around friends. The lower level could be bit crowded during happy hour but they have an upstairs where you can lounge or sit at the bar.  Overall, a fun atmosphere - pretty diverse crowd.

Came here before a Steelers game to pre-game with some food and vino. We asked the server about the house Malbec and house Pino Noir. She said she didn't know as they were listed on the menu as simply 'Malbec' and 'Pinot Noir'. Respectively, we ordered both thinking they couldn't be very bad and we added truffle fries for good measure.   The service was good, even though our server had a lot of tables to cover. The wine was TERRIBLE. Order beer instead and if you aren't into beer, skip this place all together. The truffle fries did not taste the least bit like truffles, but were crispy and delicious (I could have done without the sprinkling of NFG, non functional garnish, in the form of parmesan cheese).

I made it into Olive or Twist a few weeks ago to celebrate surviving my first week of graduate school!  My friend told me to pick wherever I wanted for a celebratory dinner, and Yelp brought me here.  The name was catchy, and the food looked cool.  And martinis are my drink of choice.  What's not to love?  We made reservations, but the bar upstairs was cooler so we went upstairs instead.  There are bar tables and couches and comfy chairs to hang out on.  The service was amazing, and we never wanted for anything.  Every need was met before we could even ask.  I started out with the Orange Dreamsicle martini, and while it was on the sweet side, it was delicious!  If I return, I will definitely get another one of these.  Not strong alcohol wise but yummy.  We ordered the scallops and Asian fusion calamari for appetizers.  My friend was super upset with the scallops and thought they tasted bad.  I don't really know anything about scallops so I ate them.  He complained to the manager, and the manager was nice enough to take 1/2 off, which I thought was really nice considering it wasn't stopping me from eating them.  (#PoorKidProblems).  The calamari was really unique but delicious.  The actual calamari was good, but it was covered in some sauce similar to stir fry sauce.  It was good, and the portion was a really fair size for the price.  I then moved onto the Key Lime Pie martini.  It was a let down after the Dreamsicle, but there was nothing wrong with it.  I personally preferred the first one.  My favorite food item was my entree.  I ordered the Penne ala Vodka, and when she put it on the table, I thought I had gone to garlic heaven.  Simple but wonderful.  There was also a very generous amount of asiago cheese on top of my pasta and a slice of prosciutto.  I took about half of the portion home, but I finished it off that night because it was so delicious.  I really loved this place, and on a Friday night, it was EMPTY.  I don't know if this was because of Labor Day weekend or a Pirates game, but we were the only people in the bar area by 8:00.  Hopefully it was just a fluke because I liked Olive or Twist!

Went to their NYE event two other years, 2015 and 2014 and it was MUCH better than 2017. Not prepared (food not ready, balloon drop not done accurately, music not working) and very poor set up. The speakers almost falling down on guests due to those too drunk and holding on to it for support. Next year I won't be going upstairs for this event. However on the downstairs seemed much nicer. Will be back for dinner as I've always liked dinner and drinks there. Bar staff was all who seemed prepared.

This is a nice trendy spot downtown. The kitchen defiantly knows what's going on. Smaller portion sizes still pack the flavor! Last time I had the salmon and this time I had the crab cake sandwich, both were excellent. The ahi tuna appetizer was small but again it was excellent. We were not impressed with the salted pretzel martini and it was a little too sweet - but the food ensured the high review! Great job to the chef and kitchen crew!

Such a nice chill bar. Anytime my friends and I just want to have a few drinks this is always our first stop. The music and atmosphere is always great every time we go and they sometimes have live music too! They have a great drink menu and good food. I've had the braised short rib and it was melt in your mouth and to die for!

Love this place. Stiff martinis and cocktails, cheap drinks, good service, nice atmosphere to chill in the upstairs lounge and hang up with your friends. Classy crowd and much more mature, older, and professional crowd. There aren't any of those college frat boys or belligerent drunks there, which is so great. Very nice place to wind down after a long day.

When your favorite drink always involves vodka, then this is your place.  They have the best selection of martini's in the Burgh.  Whether you love them sweet, dirty, or like a dessert in a glass, you'll find a favorite.  My biggest problem is that I've found one too many favorties.  While the martini's are delish, I'm not as big a fan of the food.  The buffalo chicken spread appetizer is great for happy hour but I just didn't love the other items I've tried and the entrees aren't memorable.  I recently discovered the upstairs lounge and it was comfortable and spacious (much more so than the crowded downstairs bar).   If you work downtown and you haven't stopped here for happy hour, you are missing out!

It's everything a great cocktail bar should be.  Great location, ambiance, cocktails and chill environment.  **Disclaimer:   5 stars doesn't have to mean it's New York City good. It is a simple place and it's not flashy by any means.   I'd take a girl for the beginning of a date or on the opposite end of the spectrum, talking business with colleagues.

This bar is cramped, overpriced, and the service is unbelievably slow. Happy Hour runs 4-6, so you'll show up at 5, have no place to sit or stand, and will only be able to get *maybe* 2 drinks during happy hours You'll then be told that the upstairs (which is actually not bad) will be opening at 5, even though you're asking at 5:20 (this has seriously happened all three times I've been there).  Seriously, avoid this place. When one of your co-workers suggests a work happy hour, direct them anywhere else.

Called in November to secure the upstairs for our wedding after party and were instructed that they do not accept reservations over a month prior to the event.  We were told to call back a month prior which we did only to learn that upstairs had been booked by another party.  Upon speaking to Brandon we learned they do in fact accept reservations over a month out.  So either the person we spoke with on the phone was misinformed or said that to get us off the phone.  In any case when learning this Brandon simply stated that we were wrong repeatedly and offered no alternative.  I wasn't expecting them to cancel the other party to accommodate our party.  However when I asked what he do to accommodate us he was unapologetic and rude.  The customer service displayed was some of the worst I have ever seen.  Luckily an establishment in the area heard our issue and was SYMPATHETIC and worked with us to resolve our issue.  I will never set foot in that place again or spend a single cent there ever.

Always a good spot if you are craving a martini. As per the waitress recommendation, I ordered a pear martini and my husband had a Moscow mule. Both were delicious without being sweet.   Some might find the dinner selection limited but I think it allows for the restaurant to highlight some great dishes. My husband had the Tuscan steak sandwich and he could not stop raving about it. He loved the pretzel roll that it was served on. I went a little more traditional and ordered a burger but it was a perfectly cooked burger.   This is not our first time stopping at Olive or twist and it will not be our last!
We came here for drinks on a Friday night. They had a few good scotchs to select from and the upstairs had a nice crowd which wasn't too packed. Everyone cleared out by about 12:30 am.

Very disappointed.  I had been to Olive or Twist for drinks and really enjoyed it but had never been there for a meal.  I was going to a show at the Benedum with a friend and made reservations about a week and a half before the show.  We arrived about 15 minutes early for our 6:00 reservation expecting we may not be able to be seated yet.  The problem is that even though I called and made a reservation (including the person answering the phone taking my name and phone number and repeating the date and time) we were told there was no reservation for our name.  The hostess said something along the lines of "are you sure you called here to make a reservation and not somewhere else"  Yes, I'm pretty sure I called the right restaurant...  She kept looking at the room of empty tables, looking at the book and then looking at us.  After a few minutes of back and forth, she told us the lounge upstairs was open and we were welcome to grab a table up there.  So we trudged upstairs.  All that was available were small high top tables.  Being a Friday night, it was packed with the happy hour crowd and was pretty noisy.  Not really the environment we were looking for but we decided to make the most of it. We started with the Buffalo Chicken Dip appetizer.  It is served in a martini glass with toasted/fried pita chips.  It was tasty and we were surprised at how much dip there actually was.   The problems with food began with the pacing of the meal.  We had our appetizer for under five minutes when our entrees came out.  It may not have been a big deal if we were at a real table in the restaurant downstairs, but being at the high top bar tables, we had no room for our drinks, appetizer and meal.  We found ourselves stacking stuff and pulling things off the table in order to fit everything.  It was frustrating.  Not to mention that we would either have to let our entrees get cold as we finished the appetizer or let the appetizer get cold as we ate our entrees.   With as much as we enjoyed the appetizer, we were looking forward to our meals. Unfortunately, they were very disappointing.  My friend ordered the french dip sandwich with a side of mashed potatoes.  Her potatoes were ice cold and sandwich luke warm.  When she mentioned it to the server, the server said "so would you like me to take them back or are they ok"  When would cold mashed potatoes ever be OK?  When her potatoes were brought back warmed, she was disappointed because they were called "garlic mashed" but she said they were pretty bland with not much garlic at all. I ordered the Caribbean Jerk Chicken.  It was described as "grilled chicken seasoned with jerk spices, pepper jack cheese, garlic mayo and pineapple chutney on a Kaiser roll"  No mention of a tomato.  When I got the sandwich, there were three tomatoes on it.   Thankfully I just dislike tomatoes and it wasn't an allergy issue.  There was also no pineapple chutney.  When I asked about it, the server told me they use a sauce and it must have been soaked into the roll. Overall, very disappointed.  I wanted to love Olive or Twist because I really enjoyed the time I had visited for a drink, but the dining experience was sorely lacking, especially for a dinner that was supposed to be a nice laid back start to our girl's night out.
The food is amazing! Everything we ordered was delightful. Definitely a twist on even the most simple things. Cooked to perfect, will return!

I love the calamari appetizer here -- and recently, not only did they remove it from the happy hour menu, but they cut the size by more than half and kept the price the same. Shame on you!   Additionally, they told me and my friends that all the tables were booked, and we sat at the bar for over an hour and all the tables were empty. Why are you trying to be more exclusive than you actually are? It's not good for business.

Summary: A fine place for a bite before the show or a drink/desert after  My wife and I went to Olive or Twist before a show at the Benedum on a recent week night. Two immediate points in their favor: 1. I was able to make a reservation that afternoon 2. At the time I made the reservation, they asked if I was going to a show afterward - showing attention in advance to making sure I would have a good experience with them.  We arrived a couple of minutes after our reservation and were seated immediately [at what appeared to be the last open table in the room]. The wait person asked when we were seated about whether we were headed to a show. Good on them.  The service was generally very prompt, if not a touch harried. More than one staff member was covering our table.  On the one hand, this ensured that we were taken care of promptly. On the other hand, there were several occasions when we were asked the same thing by multiple staff members. (E.g., "Would you like to place a drink order? We already have.") I think this is a net positive for someone with a show to get to, but it does detract somewhat from a relaxing meal.  We shared an Ahi Tuna appetizer. I've seen larger portions of this appetizer elsewhere - nearly every elsewhere. This was barely big enough to share. Mind you, they didn't advertise it for sharing and it would have been entirely reasonable for one person.  Similarly with the entree salads we both had. The looked small at first, but only because of the ridiculous portion sizes we have grown accustomed to at many other restaurants. The added protein portions were also not generous, but they were probably really a reasonable size for a normal adult - one who's not try to keep getting larger. (Overall, I applaud what I perceive to be a trend away from super-sized portions at some restaurants.) My wife had shrimp on hers and seemed happy. I had chicken on mine, which was a touch on the dry side, but overall I was satisfied.  I'm not normally a martini guy, but I tried a non-traditional one before dinner - the "Perfect Pear". It was fine, as far as I could tell, but I'm not a convert. I'll likely get a glass of wine the next time. My wife had a glass of white wine (I'm afraid I forget which) and was well satisfied with it.  We shared a Chocolate Covered Pretzel martini and a slice of the Chocolate Torte for desert. Viewing the martini as a desert, rather than as a drink, it was quite good. It was tasty and well presented, with the salted rim (a la a margarita) being a big part of the pretzel effect. It was a nice complement to the torte, which was quite rich, and very good. Sharing a single slice was an excellent choice for us. I would do this combination again.  We were out the door in about 70 minutes without having felt rushed, and with 30 minutes still to get to our seats in the theater. Overall, good food, drinks and service. I'll be back when I can.

This place had a really cool feeling to it! We went on a Saturday night and made reservations about 2 wks in advance. The food was all around pretty good but it was definitely tight. You will probably get a elbow or a butt hit you at least once :)

If you enjoy Martinis, then Olive-or-Twist is a must-see!  :)  Near the Lemongrass Cafe and the Renaissance Hotel, It's a cozy little bar; it's narrow and has an exposed-brick, jazz-house type of feel to it. Very dimly lit, a great little spot for an evening drink before or after a show in the Cultural District of Pittsburgh!  Obviously, their specialty is going to be martinis and they do a nice job of offering up traditional martinis as well as some fruity, tasty, sweet martinis.  They also serve food and have a nice sized menu; I've never had the opportunity to eat here, but some of the things that were coming out of the kitchen looked and smelled delish!  The crowd here is typically young, trendy and professional. By Day, its a great spot for suits to grab a quick cocktail and something to eat. By 4:30, its filling up with more suits and skirts, for the after-work crowd in downtown. By the evening, you'll have the trendy, young types. (I'm also fully convinced that this is where trendy wanna-be types will go to dress up, as-if they were at work for the day, and then go to hang out to rub elbows with those who actually do work!  lol)  This is a great place to go before or after baseball games, theater shows, and just because.  PROS: Atmosphere is a pro, here.  Pretty laid back, IMO; Great idea-inducing drink menu if you have no idea what you'd like to drink; Lots of suggestions if you want to "try something new"; Also serves food.  CONS: Parking is terrible (as with all things, Pittsburgh.  Try the garage across from the Renaissance Hotel); eh... a tad bit pricey for "just a lot of vodka", lol; it gets pretty full, pretty quick (which can also be a PRO depending on whom you ask).   *Update to follow, soon. (Its been a little while since I was there last)

Tried to order  one of the 5 dinner specials...the lobster mac and cheese and they were out (at only 7 pm... prime time dinner hr).... so I ordered the peppered salmon with mango salsa.... they brought me my meal but with no mango salsa.... just the salmon...all by itself.  I asked the waitress... didn't this come with the mango salsa topping?  She said oh yea it does... but we ran out that's why they didn't put it on..... needless to say.. it would be tough to eat peppered salmon with no salsa or sauce at all to offset the pepper.    I wasn't sure what to do at this point...so she said do you want some other sauce or something?  We asked her to check with the chef as to what he/she suggests.  5 min later she comes out and says they r going to make a new batch of mango salsa....I think to myself... I thought you were out and now they are making it?  Why didn't they do that in the first place.  They left my plate in front of me and 10 mins later they come out with a small bowl of salsa... by this time the rest of my table were done with their food...the meal was good with the salsa... but by now I was eating with everyone else done and my food was luke warm.  For a $20 meal at a  high end restaurant. ..This was quite a disappointment.

So I decided to surprise my fiancé one night by taking her here(because we've been talking about doing so for a while). We both got martinis and the nachos and buffalo spread apps. The martinis were just ok, and the food was very basic and nothing special. I will give the place another try and get some non appetizers next time and hope the bartender is a bit better at mixing the drinks.

I selected Olive or Twist for my sister's birthday dinner, mainly because the name drew me in. I made a reservation and was told there were only two timeslots available. Fortunately, one of them was fairly close to the time I was hoping for, so I went ahead and booked it. The only reason I mention this is that when we arrived, there were only two other tables in use and no one else came in the entire time we were there, which seemed a bit odd.  However, that small bit aside, the meal and experience were excellent. We both ordered the penne with vodka cream sauce, and it was absolutely delicious, as were the appetizer and drinks. I will say that they certainly do not skimp on their martinis! I generally feel that martinis tend to be on the weak side, but I actually found this one to be too strong for my taste -- fortunately, the waitress kindly offered to have the bartender lighten it up for me. On that note, they have many creative and traditional drink choices, so you can feel confident that there will be something everyone will enjoy.   The service was exceptional -- our waitress did a wonderful job and we particularly enjoyed the quiet atmosphere. We did go on a Monday night when I'm sure it was much slower than usual, but still, it seemed much quieter than your typical bar scene. It can get pricey, but it's worth it for a special occasion. All in all, a great place to go for dinner and/or drinks in an intimate setting.
My happy hour hot spot! My friends are addicted to the buffalo chicken dip. Drink specials and great food selection.

Friday night girls night out and we were on the town. Olive or Twist located near the cultural district right across from the theater was the place to be. It is mostly the young professional crowd. The decor is brick with lounge couches upstairs, welcoming you to grab a martini and have a seat while searching eyes as people go by.  I can't say this is a south side meat market vibe but the young are here to mix and meet. This particular night we were full of giggles and playful flirtations. There was some kind of CMU business men event going on and within a minute the bar was packed with young eligible bachelors in suits. Way too dressy for my taste but it was fun to talk and check people out. Everyone was friendly and from my perch on the bar it seemed everyone had mixed drinks in hand so I joined in with my signature dirty martini. It was made just right. The ambiance and music was light. I was having a good time and an even better time when offered drinks and striking up conversation. I didn't get to sample the food because we had already eaten but I will def be back. This place would be ideal for a date night. Stay tuned...

Used to come here a lot when I was in college for apps and drinks before Benedum & Heinz Hall shows. Rather small dining area- you have to make a reservation or get here a little early on those show nights. The sticky wings & buffalo chicken dip w/ chips are the best! Also enjoyed the chicken Caesar salad ... but this place is also known for the Martini Sampler during Happy Hours... You'll see many people during Happy Hour testing the different selections of Martinis! Consider Olive or Twist the next time you want a modern, mellow spot for grabbing a bite & a drink w/ a friend or significant other, especially before/after watching a Broadway show nearby!  Cons: Wait staff isn't the greatest - you may be waiting a while for a drink refill or check. Restaurant area is very small. A little pricey for the portions.
The cocktail menu options were mouth-watering. Great place to grab a drink with friends, especially on ladies' night out!

What can I say about you Olive - you're my staple, my default, but not in a bad way.  I know during those indecisive evenings which taunt me, I can always turn to you for comfort, good atmosphere, delectable food and a tasty drink.  While you're not always top of mind with the emerging bar/restaurant scene in the area, I do remember you often and stop by occasionally.  You are my go-to for happy hours that bring large groups of friends together with varying tastes.  B/c that's just who you are Olive...you appeal to the masses and don't just belong to me.  You make a killer martini and know how to attract the young professional community in the region.  What about Twist - well he brings that second wind after a long work week, the spark at the end of the night and makes you think, "who knows where this night will take me".  You make a perfect pair!    I'm glad we've become such close friends and you both always welcome me with open arms even when it's been a while.

Unreal. Made a reservation here well in advance. Got there early, ordered as soon as the waitress came over, as we were on a tight schedule to get to  the theater. Sat for exactly ONE HOUR without touching an ounce of food. The other tables around us were commenting on the terrible service as well. Finally brought soup after I had to ask for it twice. We had to leave immediately after, so we asked for the check and cancelled our dinners. No apologies and they didn't even comp the wine or soup on the bill! DO NOT COME HERE. Understaffed and unprepared for large crowds. They aren't usually open on Sundays but this weekend then opened to "accommodate" the Cultural District show traffic.

There is a reason why this place is popular. A friend recommended this place to me. I went with my coworker and the moment we stepped in, we were greeted with great service. The Drinks were great. I had the Cake Batter and DragonBerry Cosmo. Then for food I order the Lobster Mac and Cheese. I can say I wasn't disappointed. If I ever come back to Pittsburgh, I know where to go!

Four-stars for happy hour comfort.  I write this review in the context of a Friday night spontaneous happy hour.  Why four stars?  Primarily the comphy seating.  Drink selection is on par with most other swanky downtown locations (decent beer list with some fun cocktails sprinkled here and there) and the staff is what I would expect - prompt and curteous but nothing out of this world.  But then there are the chairs, couches, leather benches, and multitude of mini tables to put your drink down (which I often need to do as I have a tendency to flap my hands around while telling stories).  Upstairs is where it's at.  Note - you may want to give them a call first... the upstairs is booked for private parties sometimes and if you're stuck downstairs, it can get quite crowded.

Oh how the mighty have fallen....  Saturday night before a show, my husband and I return for appetizers. We get calamari, historically our favorite calamari ever, and nachos with chicken.  The calamari was no longer tossed with the delicious sauce, therefore I did it myself in the middle of the restaurant. Overall, still good calamari, but not the greatest.  However, the nachos, which are $11 plus an additional $5 for chicken, were awful.  They were tortilla chips with shredded cheese microwaved with tasteless "pico" some olives, sour cream and guacamole. The chicken tasted Like yesterday's leftovers thrown on top.  There was no saving these nachos.  Thankfully, our server took them off our bill.   The two of us have lots of fond memories at Olive or Twist, especially the night before our wedding.  However, after three consecutively bad trips to Olive or Twist, we are done.

One of my wife & my go-to options for drinks, apps, or a nightcap or three.  Drinks are always high quality & well-made.  Foods that we've had (primarily apps) are always delicious.  Beautiful atmosphere and an excellent hangout spot.  The brickwork is just awesome.  Live music most weekends can get very loud downstairs, but if it's too much, there's a separate lounge upstairs that's also excellent.  Been there quite a few times and never had a bad experience.

Didn't think it was possible to make a bad Old Fashioned, but this place managed to make an undrinkable one. When it came with an entire orange wedge in the drink and one hanging off the glass, I should've known. Avoid. Go to The Butcher and the Rye down the street.

Olive or Twist has the best martinis.  Cake Batter is a personal favorite.  While I usually stop with friends for a martini after a downtown event, I recently went here for dinner and a drink before a Pirates game.  Both were excellent!

I went to Six Penn Kitchen with my cousin and had a great time. We decided to continue the night at Olive or Twist. Their cocktail menu was nice with some great pairings. Be warned that the prices are not featured on the menu.  They have everything from a great twist on an Old Fashioned to building your own Mule. We came on a Tuesday night so there weren't many people in the restaurant. The bartender was very attentive and even shared the best times to come to the restaurant.   The decor is rustic with exposed brick and and large antique looking ceiling fans. This is the perfect place to have drinks and conversation. Although, I am not sure what this place would be like on a busy night.   The draft selections were typical with a few rare finds. The best part was the purse hooks under the bar for the ladies. I would give another star but I did not try the food.

Probably one of the best martini bars anywhere in the area. I've been here numerous times and have always enjoyed it here. Drinks are amazing and you get a good buzz off of just one martini. Very generous pours here. Can be pricey if you have a few though.
I loved the upstairs lounge. It got a bit noisy but otherwise this is my kind of place. Open space, not too fussy with an upscale feel. Excellent martinis.

We went here for drinks and a bite before a concert at nearby Byham theater. We had wings and a piece of cookies and cream cake. Both were outstanding. We both had the Fat Gary's Ale, but in hindsight I would have preferred a Guinness. The ambiance was suitably cave-like as a good bar should be.

Coming in on a Saturday night, we were able to start off with seats at the bar and then, moved to a plush seated section up on the second floor.  Staff was super friendly and I loved our bartender.  We definitely had a lot of fun trying out all of the yummy drinks between our group of girls.  We all had a sip each of Le Fiz, Pink Lemonade, Cucumber Basil, Root Beer Float, Mixed Berry Tea, Guava Mojito, Dewar's Arnold Palmer, Huckleberry Mojito, Pomegranate Acai Mojito (mojitos were a hit with the girls), Dark Knight (with Elderflower liqueur and creme de violette), Jameson's Ginger, The Perfect Pear, and Lemon Ginger.  Overall, a great place to stop in for drinks.  We had a group of five ladies and had no problem finding a place for us to sit down around 9pm.  We were also able to redeem a restaurant.com gift certificate here, too!  If we ever return to Pittsburgh, I wouldn't mind popping back in again.
This place is good for drink before and after shows. I always wanted to try their food, but haven't yet. They have lots of different martinis. I will be back.

After hearing many positive things about the martinis here, we finally made our way down to experience it for ourselves. It was totally worth it!   We arrived around midnight on a Friday (well, technically Saturday I guess) and there still was a decent crowd being the place is downtown. We ordered our drink upstairs and eventually made our way back downstairs and sat outside so my boyfriend and his friends could smoke. The upstairs is fairly big and definitely had enough room so you don't feel packed together. There is your basic bar seating, as well as couches and chairs that give it a lounge sort of feel. It didn't take anytime at all for a friendly bartender to notice us and take our drink order.   They had a lot of really interesting sounding drinks, but we decided to go with the Pumpkin Spice martini because it's October (like, duh!!). Wow! Now, I'm not one for martinis as I have mentioned in previous reviews for other places, but this was amazing! The best martini I've ever had. So delicious and super easy to take down, yet you could still taste the alcohol so you know they didn't short you.   After spending some time upstairs, we traveled downstairs to check out the first floor. There was definitely a different vibe. It was slightly older and not as bumping. I also got to take a peak at their menu because I would love to come back and try their food.   As I mentioned above, we ended our night outside as they have a few tables and chairs. This is always the best because sometimes it's nice to escape the madness of a bar, especially if you're out with smokers. OOT is also located near the Cultural District so I didn't feel unsafe standing outside at a late hour.

Decided to give this place a try because of the $10 for $20 yelp deal. Had a bowl of "chunky" clam chowder which was tomato based & excellent! Sort of small for a bowl. I also tried the cobb salad which had lots of huge chunks of turkey but was lacking much of the other ingredients including luttace. It was definetly not worth 16 bucks. I would not go to this place again without another coupon to entice me. However the service was outstanding and atmosphere is pretty cool.

The bar staff is great, but the food quality has definitely taken a downward turn over the past year. I was recently at the bar and was overcome by a foul smell. For those of you that know what Urnex is, that's exactly what I thought (and hoped) it was. Alas, I was told by the bar staff that it was the scallops. Worse yet, they said they come from a can. I nearly puked. I love this place so much, but I am terribly saddened by the lack of the quality in the dishes coming out of the kitchen these days.

I could probably say more about Olive or Twist if I didn't black out every time I've gone. The martinis are super good and the food is also pretty decent. It can be pretty busy though and difficult to get service. They are also always renting out the top room (good for them!) which makes a small bar feel even smaller. There is a reason why this place is so popular downtown and it is a solid place. It isn't a standout but I definitely go there more than I go to a lot of the standout places in the city.
Sooo blacked out here that We heckled the guitarist. Not sorry. He sucked.

We ordered the calamari, caprese salad, and truffle fries. The calamari was probably the best flavorful calamari I've had with its crispiness that was not hidden by the delicious and zesty Asian sauce. Everything was plated nicely, and the caprese salad was quite good for winter tomatoes. I'm not much of a french fry person (I know, kill me), but the basil aioli complemented the parmesan.   Great appetizers in the heart of the Cultural District! I was sad that we barely missed the 4PM-6PM Happy Hour (Monday-Thursday), but that's life. I visited Olive or Twist last week before The Second City improv show, and I highly recommend it if you are going to a show as well.

I can't comment on the food. However this is a really nice place to have a drink or two. The upstairs is really nicely laid out. Nice atmosphere and the service has always been very good. Prices are also reasonable for downtown. It's also a really good place to people watch after a Pirate game lets out.. Some real characters...
Solid place to grab a martini and listen to some sub-par live music. Far from amazing but hey not everywhere is going to be right?

Don't bother.   We were kind of desperate to find a place that wasn't too pricy and close to our hotel on a Monday night. We saw this place, with the low lighting and witty name (although we weren't sure if they're cleaver enough to make the theater reference or if it was simply a mistake).  They boast a new menu and I got the pasta with goat cheese and almonds. I didn't have high expectations but this was like family meal before your serving shift. It was boring and flavor free. My boyfriend got a steak sandwich that looked punny. Oh, and the grocery store wine was way over priced.  Boo!
Hands down my favorite happy hour spot in Pittsburgh. Amazing atmosphere with an even more awesome staff. Friendly, hip and chic environment that I will come back to for every happy hour!

I've only had drinks and appetizers here, so take this with the proverbial grain of salt. This is the my bar of choice when I'm in town and going out with my Yinzer colleagues for after-work libations. They have good happy hour specials, a nice beer and wine selection, and they mix a good cocktail. Oh, and the truffle fries are the bomb. Service is always fast and friendly, too.
Love olive or twist. Chill atmosphere. Great drinks!

I had the Pork Belly sandwich with sweet potato fries, girlfriend had chicken quesadilla with truffle fries, dad had the burger, mom had the Reuben. Everything was great, great service, will go again!!

Good drinks and a good appetizer to snack on. I gave four stars because the bar is kind of informal and I did not like the crowds.  it's a martini bar but it feels like a dive bar. The music was great.  if I had a choice I will give one a  four and a half stars. The location is very central and I had a beer. My friend had a "dark knight" he said it was good. They even made my beer from two different varieties because I like a black and blond. Try it. Maybe go  earlier than  9pm on a Friday.

I stopped in here for a drink yesterday and to meet some friends at the upstairs lounge. Love it! So spacious, great art work on the walls and the bartenders were extremely nice and attentive. The happy hour drink prices were also pretty good. I didn't get a chance to try any food but I did wander down for a minute and it seemed like everyone was having a good time. I'll def be back!

The drinks are perrrrrrrrfect!  Totally hit the spot.  Favorites are cookie dough and cake batter.  Though the drinks are 5 star, the food leaves much to be desired.  Prices are high and the taste subpar.  I have had the crab cake - small, dry, expensive and the scallops - large, dry, expensive with an interesting strawberry garnish that I thought was an odd addition for the flavoring produced.    Anywho, get a drink off the menu - well worth the price and yuuuuuumy taste!

Went here several months ago, excited to try the myriad martinis on the list.  We had a restaurant.com certificate so that availability might make me return for value only.  The boyfriend got a tuna melt which was completely unremarkable; it seems to have been removed from the menu now.  We got 4 martinis between us--the Pink Lemonade (okay), Orange Dreamsicle (sickly sweet), Cake Batter (again, just tasted like sugar), and the Black and Gold (this admittedly was excellent).  The waitress helped us pick our selections so I was surprised at the lack of balance in these for a place seeming to specialize in martinis.    Bottom line, happy hour + restaurant.com certificate might make this worthwhile, especially with a more careful eye towards sugar-overload.  And get the Black and Gold.
So I came into the restaurant for lunch and the soup was so yummy. I had the Stuff pepper soup one day. And the cream of mushroom. There soup is always really good and flavorful

Stopped by after enjoying "Young Frankenstein" at the Byham Theatre.    This venue is just a short walk across the street from the Byham so was very convenient.  The interior has a very pleasant atmosphere.  We sat at the bar to have drinks and an appetizer.  With the kind bartender's help, I ordered the chocolate pretzel martini.  My glass was decorated with chocolate stripes on the inside and a rim covered with chocolate and salt.  This was definitely a winner in both presentation and taste.  We ordered the nachos without any protein added.  They looked good but there wasn't enough topping for the number of chips so many chips were eaten dry without anything on it.  Definitely needed more cheese and "goo" to make these worthwhile.  The appetizer part of the menu was good and priced right so I'd come back and just try something else next time.
Cute spot and staff is hilarious! I had a blast last week and can't wait to go back:)

Didn't imagine a hip but chill place like this in downtown Pittsburgh. The music isn't overly loud, and it's a great place to hang out with friends. Or some family, in my case ;)  They have a second floor with ample mingle space, even a little side room you can rent out if you have a big group. The price for the room was pretty cheap (around $50), so it makes for a great private party space.  The drinks are pretty good and strong, and they have a lot of good alcohol selection if you don't like the cocktail list they offer. They specialize in martinis, so try one to decide for yourself if you like it.

Found you on Yelp and weren't disappointed. Very friendly waitstaff and good food (bar fare). Yummy desserts. The acoustics downstairs were terrible. Exposed brick everywhere and no noise dampening.  Not the best place for an intimate dinner or quiet conversation on the weekend. But a young, fun, party like atmosphere. Convenient to cultural district.

I have only sat at the bar here and only have had a Martini.  In saying that, I like how friendly this place is and the staff is attentive.  They make a mean Martini for $10.00.   The place is clean and so are the bathrooms.

One of worst experiences.  We sat at the bar to eat before a show.  It took a while for the bartender to acknowledge us.  Once we ordered it took over 30 minutes for the food to come.  My crab cake was completely black on the underneath.  I didn't have time to get anything else since it took so long to begin with so I went to the show starving.  My husband got the lobster Mac n cheese.  It was horrible.  Tasted like a bowl of pasta covered in salt.  There wasn't any cheese in it.  There were other groups there complaining as well.  One was there before us and never even got there food.  I won't even give this place a second chance.

Olive or Twist is convenient place to go before or after shows in Pittsburgh's Cultural District or Pirates baseball games. The inside is very nice, pleasant and comfortable. I was there on a Friday. The entertainment was excellent (a one-man band by the name of Mark Pipas -- who played music from all genres and rarely took breaks). The bar tenders are friendly and make great drinks, but if the place gets busy -- be warned -- the service can be tragically slow. I didn't have food, but the food that I saw looked good. My biggest complaint is the drink prices. I realize that this is a downtown establishment. It's somewhat upscale, but it's not the Ritz. I'm not at all cheap, but $4.25 for an IC Light, $7.75 for a normal-size Captain and Coke and $7.75 for a shot of Jaeger (though it was a generous pour), is a bit high for such a social bar in Pittsburgh, even if it's downtown, and even if it's somewhat upscale.
Underpriced 4-star cocktails and overpriced 3-star food. Good spot to meet friends but not a great date venue.
I go here pretty often for drinks. They have the best variety of martinis and it's lively in the evenings. The buffalo chicken spread is highlyyyy recommended.

So, groupon made this evening possible.  Thank you, groupon.  Picked my husband up from work in Market Square and walked over to Olive or Twist at about 5 pm. Parkings a b***.  I'm so glad we walked.  It was happy hour on friday and the bar was packed FULL.  Buzzing with business men and women looking to loosen their collars for the weekend.  The place seemed alive.   We edged our way around the bar to the hostess table where we were warmly greeted and sat quickly (make a reservation though...we were only sat because aparently another party canceled even though the dining room was empty? whatever its fine) Was a little too loud from the bar, for a couple looking for a romantic dining experience but I'm not complaining.  We were seated in the dining room wich has beautiful rustic brick walls revealed and a warm ambiance.  I was really excited about the menu. Everything on it sounded decadent.  So much so, that I couldn't decide and ordered TWO entree's!  I never do that.  I ordered the Fettucini Boursin (reccomended by the waitress) and their  Pear & Candied Pecan Salad (I added chicken for $2)   ............. The salad--- FABULOUS.  Bleu cheese crumbles atop mixed greens, a crisp fresh sliced pear, and the most amazing strawberry vinagarette I have ever had. The chicken I added was very juicy. The only downer about the salad, is I hardly got any candied pecans... they were few and far between and when I did get some, they were more like candied pecan crumbs you find at the bottom of the bag.  That just told me the chef for whatever reason, must have been out of them.  But if your going to call it a pear and candied pecan salad, it needs to have a reasonable amount of pecans.    ...............................Next, was the Fetuccini Boursin.  The waitress raved about this, and I think I see why.  They top it with a yummy sharp cheese shaved in a pile that is really delicious. But for me, the plate in general was a bit dry and the sauce was the consitency of elmers glue..not just thick, I mean... sticky and dry.  I like it more moist.  In my opinion, Olive Gardens fettucini is better, but it satisfied my pasta craving, nevertheless.    My husband ordered the Carribean Jerk Chicken Sandwich with a side of broccoli instead of fries.   HE LOVED EVERY BITE.   He was hesitant to even let me have a taste he wanted it all to himself.     Our waitress was so kind and welcoming.   Overall, it was a great experience.  We enjoyed it and it made for a nice evening.  We will probably come back,but not without another coupon.  Its questionable wether the food is truly worth full price or not, but thats just my opinion.   I really want to try their happy hour drinks.  They looked delicious, and obviously they are, if they are drawing such a crowd.  This is a nice little place :)  Give it a try.

I came here before a pirates game, so it was around 5:30ish or so in the evening, we had just gotten lucky that they had a table open before all there reservations for the night started to come in.  I ordered the chicken jerk sandwich with a side salad, absolutely loved it!  The chicken had the perfect amount of spice to it which was off set with sweet with the pineapple chutney it had on it, sooo good!  The salad was even great because they used real green spring mix instead of iceburg lettuce.  I also loved that they put feta cheese on top, its one of my favorite cheeses for salad topping!  Service was great here and even though I didn't have a drink here that night I have a previous time and they are yummy!  Love this place and can't wait for my next visit!

I went here after work around 4:30 without a reservation with my friend and it was the best time to come. Their happy hour is 4-6 on the weekdays and I was able to get $4 Cabernet that was really delicious. There were reservations on every table, but not until around 7 so we had time to enjoy ourselves. I got the jerk chicken sandwich on the recommendation of the server and I have to tell you it was delicious!! The chicken wasn't too dry and the jerk seasonings were perfect. I also got the sweet potato fries for a side and they were very good. I wish they were a little more crispy, but they were still good. We also ordered the creme brûlée and I ordered the black manhattan drink to go along. Both were just amazing and exactly what I wanted for after a delicious, but not too filling dinner. Drinks were top notch.

We chose this restaurant since it was close to the Byham and an easy walk for my elderly parents.  When I realized we were going, I purchased a Groupon. The seating is very limited so reservations on a Friday or Saturday night are a must. The menu is very limited with only about 5 or 6 entrees not including sandwiches and wraps that are offered.  So check out the menu online to make sure you find something you like. It is very noisy due to the small seating area, the nearby bar and the brick interior.  The braised short ribs were very tasty and tender. The vodka penne with chicken was good.  In summary, if you are looking for a quiet romantic dinner for a special occasion, this is not the place.  However, for a good meal convenient in the theatre district, Olive or Twist is a fine choice.

I got a pack of those City Dining Cards (you get $10 off on a $30 minimum food purchase at participating restaurants) and decided to use the Olive or Twist card for a dinner prior to seeing the Phantom of the Opera at the Benedum.  I've been to this place once before for dinner and a couple of other times just for drinks. I've never really been blown away by my experiences there but I've never had any reason to complain either.  I got there at 6:00 and the place was pretty packed with the happy hour crew and theater goers but I got lucky and nabbed the last two stools at the end of the bar. I was greeted cheerfully and almost immediately by the bartender who showed me the beer list. I choose to stay local ordering an East End Fat Gary and looked over the menu as I waited for my date to arrive.  Although it was a little loud, the atmosphere was very comfortable and my lady and I contributed to the noise as we discussed how our day went before ordering off of the menu. I was torn between the Crispy Braised Pork Belly Sandwich and the Pan-Seared Atlantic Char. But my decision got easier when my date choose the char... we have this rule that we will never get the same thing so that we can share each other's entrée.  Our orders came about 15 minutes later. The pork belly was amazing! Cheddar, bacon, lettuce, tomato and a creamy sauce topped the pork belly in between a really fresh Ciabatta bun. Mmmm, delicious! It also came with a side and being as cold as it has been, the tomato basil soup was nice compliment to the sandwich. Off course I got to taste the Atlantic Char that my girlfriend ordered. It looked and tasted a little like a good cut of salmon only a little thicker and saltier. It was good, but I really think that my sandwich was the tastier of the two meals.  Olive or Twist? I'd say it's a good pre-theater option and I'd recommend it. The service was good, the bartender was attentive, the food was excellent and the price was competitive for the area. My only knock, and it's really not much of a knock, is that I think the serving portions are a little less than what we here in America have grown accustomed to. Most restaurants serve you much more food than you really should consume and that's one of the reasons why we here in America have more of an obesity issue than other nations.

I stopped in last night for a drink with a group of friends... we were in town visiting and I had been wanting to try this place out since we walked past it on the last trip... what a disappointment.  The server was prompt to greet us and drop off drink menus, but then she failed to return to take our order for at least 20 minutes.  It would've been different if she had been slammed, but the entire time she was standing by the bar, just talking to her coworkers.  By the time she came to take our order we were ready to leave... and we should have... the martinis were not good and the server's disposition left much to be desired.  When we were ready to leave she made us feel like it was a bother to split our tabs between the five of us.  The one positive of the place was that I liked the ambiance, but it wasn't enough to make up for everything else being lackluster.  What I was hoping to be a great ending to the night turned into a dismal experience that put everyone in a bad mood.

Back when I lived in Pittsburgh, this was #1 on my list for late night drinks.  They have a small seating area and bar downstairs, with live music on the weekends.  Upstairs is another bar and a large lounge area with trendy music playing in the background.  They're open late, and they have amazing drinks and appetizers.  I never ate there for lunch or dinner, so I can't comment about their main dishes...but I can definitely attest to their drinks and appetizers.

Ate here on a Saturday night before the Nationals-Pirates game (go Nats!!!). We were lucky to find seats at the bar, considering the few tables for people without reservations were taken and getting a reservation here is serious business, apparently. I had a decent pour of pinot grigio and my boyfriend had a beer, both probably a little overpriced but what can ya do. The buffalo dip appetizer was served in a martini glass (nice touch) and came with a ton of really nice pita slices. FAN. I got a grilled cheese with tomato soup, and wasn't happy to find tomato slices in the grilled cheese sandwich since I am 99% sure it was not listed as having tomatoes inside it on the menu (I know I know, I like tomato soup but not raw tomatoes, get over it). When I took the tomato slices off of the sandwich, a woman at the bar next to me voiced her displeasure with my action to her husband. I'm sorry, is this your sandwich?? BYE. Anyways, the soup was great and the de-tomatoed sandwich was delicious too. My boyfriend got sweet potato fries (YUM) and a steak sandwich which I enjoyed stealing bites of. All in all we had a pleasant experience, only made better by our groupon!

If you are a female group be prepared to be ignored by the male bartenders.  Stood patiently to get waited at the bar upstairs a male customer came up and he quickly served he pointed out to the bartender we had been standing there and he just looked at him like so what.  Guess the men at olive or Twist only like men.

In town on business and I always try to find places like this.  Wow, a martini bar not named the Blue Martini?  OK, I'm in!  So I strolled over and walked in.  First impression was it was a cool, cozy, and trendy joint.  Liked the exposed brick walls, lighting, etc.  Only problem is, I don't go to a restaurant or a bar to eat and drink the atmosphere!  So I grab a table in the bar.  It was about 5pm and there might have been 15 people in the whole place.  Two bartenders made eye contact with me so I figured they would be waiting on me.  I figured wrong.  I sat there for a good ten minutes and was getting ready to get up and leave when the younger tender came over and said with a "deer in the headlights look", do you want a drink or something????  Well hell, what was your first guess?  I refrained from quoting Foxworthy and saying "here's your sign"!  So OK we were off to a bumpy start.  I didn't have a martini, however there was a few options on the drink menu.  I was just here for a bite, so my review is based on that.  A few minutes later the other bartender comes back with my water and gives me a menu.  I ordered some turkey wrap with a fruit salad for a side.  I say "some" turkey wrap because it was really that unimpressive!    It seemed to take forever for it to arrive.  Given the fact that it wasn't busy, it did take a long time to arrive.  When it did, it looked OK.  The fruit salad looked as if it was ready for the trash, so I bypassed that.  The wrap just had zero flavor and was loaded with lettuce........way to much.  The only flavor that presented itself was blandness!  It was very disappointing.  All in all, I think this is probably a way better bar to have a drink in then a restaurant.  I will return to try a martini, but I will pass on the food.

Me and one of my besties recently came here for a girl's night out on the town.  Since we're both parents and don't get out often without our children in tow, we wanted to make sure that we fully enjoy our food and drink wherever we decide to go.  We actually enjoyed ourselves very much, thank you, at this wonderful downtown spot.  We both ordered specialty martinis.  I had the Pink Lemonade and she had the Dragon Berry Cosmo.  Both drinks were delicious!  We also ordered Olive or Twist Calamari and the Thai Chicken wings as appetizers. (Yes, I know that's a lot of food for two people.  But, didn't I say we don't get out much in the evening without kids in tow?)  Yummy is the word for both.  I like my wings crispy and my calamari not overdone and both fit the bill.  Now, about my braised beef short ribs.  Like some people wouldwalk a mile for a Camel, I would walk 10 miles for beef short ribs.  If I can take my fork and push the meat into collapse and have a good sauce to go with, I'm all yours!  My last name should now be "OliveOrTwist"!  Likewise, my bestie sat in silence and payed homage to the crabcake gods/goddesses that prepared her crabcakes.  A moment of slence please....  Okay, I'm back.  But seriously, if you want to feel transported from Pittsburgh and imagine yourself in a hip little bar/restaurant in a more trendy city, this is your place.

The Partner In Cuisine (PIC) and I had an early dinner there recently thanks to Groupon and we were not disappointed.  Since we weren't sure what to get and were just generically hungry, we decided to just let the menu decide for us and we ordered one of each of the highlighted items on the menu - the "house specials" according to our server.  The calamari was excellent and it was apparent that it had been hand breaded.  The Asian fusion made for a delicious alternative to the typical calamari that was reminiscent of a General Tso's squid.  The main dishes were also good, but nothing in particular stuck out about them.  I also had a red-velved martini which I thought was probably the best part of the meal.  Overall, I would definitely go back on a weeknight for happy hour or on a Tuesday to try the variety of mini martinis, but I think I'll leave paying $9 for an alcoholic beverage to "special" nights and not just a typical weekend dinner.  They do lose a star because even though we were one of three occupied tables and a few taken seats at the bar, the service was incredibly slow.  It took so long for our appetizer to come out, I began to question whether the cook had to get in his car and go down to Wholey's to buy more squid.

Bossa Nova's step-sister bar, but not the evil jealous step sister more like the older a little more mature caring step-sister. At least in the way of making a carefully crafted unique martini or cocktail.   Atmosphere is a little more cramped, but usually you can still find a table late on a week or weekend night if you do not mind sitting in the back. It is fine for me because I don't like being sandwiched at the bar with other people's conversations in my face.   I didn't try the food but my friend ordered the Tuna appetizer and she said she loved it just wished the portions were a little better. But for the price it wasn't bad.   I ordered the Perfect Pear cocktail with Pear Absolute Eldleweiss flower liqouer and a splash of pineapple juice it was delicious! Not too sweet and I despise sweet drinks. The perfect blend of soft tangy tartness. Much more creative then the drink menu at Bossa Nova.  For the drop in spot after a show or just happy hour with friends I found this to be a pretty down to earth and decent spot. The waitress was not that great but she was young, some things are forgiven if the product is just right.
Great martins! Placed is decorated nicely and is appealing.....but quite noisy. Food was delicious!

Before the Titanic at Benedum.  Good service and low crowd density.  Ordered entre of crab cakes for both of us.  Crab cakes were all fill and virtually no crab, and dry.  Sauce on the side appeared to be Grey Poupon?  We asked for melted butter instead and that took a moment of thought about if it could be done as a substitute.  Asparagas was mismatched on stalks and tips in my view.  And very low proportion of asparagus.  For an entre, this did not make the grade at all.  As an aside we have had crab cakes in many places to include Maryland... I doubt we will return.  I should have had the calamari appetizer.

Girls night had to happen. We decided to go to Olive or Twist, because it was close and I did have a coupon.   I was delighted with this bar/restaurant. I never knew that they had an upstairs! Upstairs they have couches and comfortable chairs with coffee tables in between them.  So much more comfortable than sitting on wooden or bar stools. And after a long day at work, being comfortable is really all that I am about. The music was slightly loud but still tolerable, and enjoyable because it was older rap music that we started to then sing and dance to (in our chairs!).  We all ordered food and drinks. I got the burger, which wasn't anything special, but I wasn't expecting the sun and the moon from it. My friends ordered the jerk chicken and the bean quesadilla. The jerk chicken was amazing. They had this jalapenos sauce on it, wooo hooo. It was so good. A perfect mix of sweet and spicy that was mouth watering. I kept on dipping my fries it in. Yummy!  The drinks were also perfect. I ordered the Wild Tea Mojito and the Pink Lemonade. Both of these drinks were refreshing and delicious. I just wanted to just go down the drink menu and check off all each and every one of those cocktails! I wanted to know if all of them could be as good as the two that I tried.   It was a great and comfortable experience for a bar. I will be going back soon!

Scouring downtown Pittsburgh for a good spot Saturday night, we ended up at Olive or Twist, which was a delight.   Live music is always a plus for me. We wanted seats at the bar but there were only tables to the side that did not offer service available, which was more than fine for me.   I felt for what the establishment was, the drinks were a bit pricier than other places in town, but it's still fairly inexpensive in Pittsburgh. My friend ordered dinner despite stuffing our faces earlier. He couldn't finish his meal, but enjoyed it none the less.   Not a bad option to check out.

This is my second time coming and I still love it and especially the Buffalo chicken spread! The atmosphere is a little dark for lunch time but over all it was a good experience.The service was also great.
If your name is 'olive or twist' the employees behind the bar should be able to make a dirty martini that's tolerable.  Poor service too. Why come here?

Olive Or Twist is a really cool place for drinks. The space is a little tight depending on what time you get there, but the drinks are very strong, unique and tasty! The service could be better and the staff could be friendlier but all and all, it is a good place to sit back, have a good, strong martini. I ordered the "Perfect Pear" martini recently and it was very strong tasting compared to the other time I had it. You get your money's worth of alcohol in their martinis for sure! This definitely is not a place where you get a watered down drink. The place is dimly lit and the walls are dark, which makes for a comfortable setting, no matter how busy the bar is. There is live music, which is very good and isn't loud to the point that you can't hold a conversation with those around you. I would definitely recommend this place for their strong, unique martinis with a punch that will have you feeling it in no time, as well as for their dark ambiance and live music. Thumbs up!

Very nice place. Food is excellent. Portions could be a tad bigger.  Not that I was still hungry, just that it tasted that good.  Would suggest more entree selections.  Variety could be a bit better.  I'd also like to mention that I'd like to have the option of dining upstairs but only seems to be available to private functions.  Keep up the good work, and really appreciate the restaurant.com deal.  Will be back.

Always a great place to get a drink before or after a show. I've always enjoyed it here. The mixed drinks are very creative in how they make them....and they always look good even though my wife always orders them while I stick to Safire & Tonics, red wine or beer. I remember the calamari being in the top five in Pittsburgh.   The live music is usually pretty good. My only complaint is that the downstairs is a little small and gets very crowded very quickly. Pus the upstairs, while a tad more spacious, doesn't have a lot of seating so you just stand around a crowded bar too.   But, it's always a good time, the service has always been very good, and people don't realize there's more to this place than just drinks. The food is under rated and tasty. Always on a recommend to other list.

Drinks wise, Olive or Twist had some of the best and most creative drinks I had in Pittsburgh. There were two full pages of mixed cocktails and martinis. Someone like me that appreciates a finely made girly drink really loved this spot. Beer enthusiasts, like my husband, will leave disappointed since their beer list is pretty lacking.  We went on a Friday at about 6 and it was packed to the max downstairs. We were able to snag a table at the upstairs lounge and a server came over pretty quickly to wait on us. The Chocolate Covered Salted Pretzel Martini was my absolute fave and after a few of them, I felt delirious and slightly buzzed. I hate ordering drinks from a menu that has no prices -- seriously, though, we're not all made of money -- so I expected the worst. I was pleasantly surprised when I got the bill as I didn't think $9 was bad for the drink since it got me feeling reeeal good.  It felt like a great spot to hit up after a long week of work and I would definitely return should I find myself in Pittsburgh again.

Warning: Do NOT come here on a Saturday night. Cause that's what I did. And it sucked because nobody was there. Ok, not nobody, maybe like 12 people including the staff and my crew of 5.  It looked great in there, big comfy couches, a huge bar with a big selection, high ceilings with beautiful exposed brick, but empty.   I am not from around the area and was just in town visiting. I would go back, but definitely not on a Saturday night. Don't go on Saturday. Seriously, don't do it.

A haven for suits and the theater crowd, Olive or Twist has a great selection of creative martinis for all drinkers- from a dirty martini to a sweet martini- you'll find what you want. I love the nuts'n'berries.  They don't shy from new ideas either- a friend ordered a "tootsie roll" concoction she figured out (chocolate and orange liquor) and managed to have a delightful drinking experience.   Food is all right, not a place I consider for a full meal (though I've done it). I suggest it for drink potential and perhaps some appetizers.

This place has become a usual spot for date night and before events and games. Mainly come for the drinks. The Moscow mules ( my go-to drink) is  made perfectly here with different seasonal options. Apple cider mule is definitely worth going back for in the fall. Bartenders know their stuff and tweak drinks for your preferences. The special martinis never disappoint. I always seem to stick to the pear and rosemary. The food is pretty good. Even better because they often have groupons or deals running.
Have loved every martini I've tried! I especially loved the caramel apple in the Fall! Great spot for happy hour with friends!

I am usually not one to go downtown, but hubby got a Group on for this place and I was so glad he did!!   This place is known to be a martini bar, and boy do they know their stuff.   When we arrived we were promptly seated and our waiter took our order. Since I am a sucker for cucumber, I opted for the cucumber basil martini. Let me tell ya, this beverage was not only pretty to look at but very tasty and refreshing to boot. My husband opted for one of their beers on draft.  For our main I decided to go for their braised short ribs which pretty darn good. The short ribs had this really tasty wine sauce, with a side of mashed potatoes and some really tasty asparagus. Everything about this dish was delectable.   My husband on the other hand, opted for their hamburger with some bacon and Swiss cheese. I had a taste of it and it was pretty good. My husband really liked and the fact that it was cooked to his specifications.   I really liked the ambiance of the place. The exposed brick the old bar. It just had a romantic feel to it. Definitely a good place for a first date as it is a little intimate.   Really like the fact that they can make a mean martini and the romantic decor. If I am ever in the neighborhood I will more than likely hit this place up again!

We stopped in before the Yelp Elite CLO's A (Musical) Christmas Carol. This wasn't my first time at Olive or Twist - and I had enjoyed myself before. We had cocktails (tried a sip of each other's) and two appetizers:  -- Ruby Red Bellini: Deep Eddy Grapefruit Vodka, Aperol, Sugar Cane, Lime Prosecco -- Black and Gold Martini: Belvedere, Lemoncello, Chambord, Sours, Lemon -- Olive or Twist Calamari: Fresh Breaded Calamari, Zesty Asian Sauce, Scallions -- Crispy Kalettes: Kale, Sea Salt, Cracked Pepper, Parmesan  My bellini was outstanding; and, the martini was fantastic as well - both with fresh mixers and sugar rims. The calamari with an Asian twist was texturally and flavorfully delicious and actually paired very well with the fried kale. The combination of our cocktails and two appetizers was a perfect pre-theater experience - especially with the Byham right across the street (and Heinz Hall right down the street) and a parking garage right next door.  The only negative note I have is that service was a bit slow; however, we were there at 5:30 (with the Steelers/Colts Sunday Night Football game later in the evening). Overall, I'm a fan of Olive or Twist - the cocktails, food, price, and location!
Good drinks (I had the guava margarita and the peach martini) and great music selection. I didn't eat - but I plan on going back soon to try the food!

Nice surprise.  Expecting bar food when looking for a quick dinner while in town on business from Florida, we were presently surprised by the variety and quality at a reasonable price. The Buffalo Chicken spread was a flavorful hummus fare served with pita bites that were wonderful while warm. I had the Ahi Tuna Taco Platter that was tasty as well. The house Merlot was short of the $9/glass price, but overall this was time and money well spent.

I went here couple of month ago for late night drink.  I was a little drunk when I went in here, just a little bit, so I don't recall things quite precisely but I liked the atmosphere. Dim lighting which I liked. Friendly staff. Nothing special for drinks.

So I had previously visited olive or twist with my boyfriend a couple months back, and we were a bit underwhelmed.  I luckily decided to give it another chance.  My mom and I dined here before seeing a show.  We arrived at 6:20 on a Friday and luckily made it in time for happy hour, $5 glasses of wine and half price crispy kalettes for us! Our service was speedy (and very pleasant), so we were able to order second glasses before the special was over.  Our kalettes were very interesting! Crispy and cheesy, my favorite! I ordered the lobster mac and cheese and my mom ordered the poutine fries.  We both enjoyed our dishes and we shared, so I can vouch for both entrees when I say they're tasty and filling!  Perhaps our favorite part of the evening, however, was the banana caramel xango.  It was delicious and it was prepared so that it was perfect for sharing!

The restaurant.com voucher sure helped me out. The prices were very high for average sized portions. We came here for a celebration so ordered the works--entrees, appetizers, dessert. The dessert xango was omg great! The wings here were pretty tasty but their scallop dish could have used more flavor. We came here on a Wed night and it was hella crowded. I made a reservation and we still had to wait 20 minutes for our spot! The space is tiny, dark and crowded and we eventually got seated next to the long queue of people waiting for their seats :(. Atmosphere = C, Service = A-. Food = B+
