I was bummed that my large party couldn't secure the upstairs lounge area (they already had a booking there), but Lauren and Caitlin were both so superb to us.  They found us a large table in the back for our group in record time and keep the food and drinks coming.  Love, love, love their martini selection and live music was an added bonus to the evening.

Went on a Friday evening for cocktails. I ordered a gin martini, it was delicious. For a snack we ordered pan seared scallops in a strawberry basil sauce. We were so surprised when the huge sea scallops were put in front of us! They were cooked perfectly and the sauce was bright and fresh, and for only $12!   The reason I'm giving 3 stars is because of the atmosphere. This place is set up weird, and there were only 2 or 3 full tables in the "dining room". The crowd was full of 40 somethings and there was a cover band, playing all the hits from the 70's and 80's. We didn't stay long.

My review for Olive or Twist is strictly for the bar.  I had my first Moscow Mule there last night and it was absolutely delicious. The bartenders were pouring heavy, and we received quick and friendly service.  They have about 10 beers on tap, mostly craft beer, though they didn't have any porters or stouts.   The specials on their food menu sounded good and the food I saw come out of the kitchen looked pretty good as well.

I haven't been here in years and it definitely won't be long before we go back. My soup and sandwich were perfect and so delicious and my husbands burger had to have been good because it was gone before I had a bite. Buff chick dip appetizer was on point too and apparently it was happy hour because it was half off!  It was kind of spicy (to me bc I'm a wimp...husb said not spicy) so I sucked my water down pretty quick and had to resort to some ice chewing until it was refilled, but it was pretty busy for just a couple servers. Staff was super nice even with being so busy.  Only giving 4 stars not 5 because we actually tried going here around 10p a couple weeks ago and the bartender that told us the kitchen was closed was pretty rude about it.

I rate this 5 stars for martinis and lounge, but it's only a 4 for me because the food was average.  I went here with a group of friends for a birthday, The fiance and I had dinner downstairs first and then went upstairs to the lounge.  If you are with a group, it's a pretty fun and chill place and they were playing good danceable music, which my friends and I liked.  It didn't seem that packed for a saturday, so it was easy to get a drink.  I think there's also servers walking around the lounge to take orders, so another plus.  The dining area was pretty small, but we made a reservation just about 2 hours prior to arriving, and we didn't have to wait. My fiance and I shared the calamari, which was really delicious!  Usually, the calamari we get is seasoned with just salt & pepper with maybe some breading at times and chilli and scallions, but this one was a different taste and it was tasty!  It seemed a little asian inspired kind of like sweet with some crumble and salty with soy.  I had the seared ahi tuna salad.  I liked the taste, but it isn't the best ahi to me.  Fish didn't taste that fresh to me.  My fiance had the braised short rib with the mashed potatoes and he said it was only 3 stars for him. He got his friend a turkey wrap and he said it was average.   The real highlight for us were the martinis!  I am not one for martinis but after tasting sweet/bakery inspired martinis, I am feening for it. LOL.  I had the cake batter martini and the chocolate covered pretzel.  Sooo good! They got really creative here with the martinis and the presentation.  Definitely 5 stars for the martini bar :)  Will go back to taste the rest!

Happy hour specials are $1 off drafts and half-priced appetizers. Try the calamari, it's got a funky sauce but really tasty.  Olive or Twist is usually really crowded for HH on Fridays, which is when my work crew usually rolls in.  I've only been here once during a non-friday HH, and it was much more enjoyable.  The food has been hit-or-miss, but I have generally been impressed with the apps.    I gave this place three stars because of several things.  I've tried a lot of beers here, but I often get them with a glass of 'funk.'  They need to clean their lines more often to get rid of that taste, and drop the price a bit; this is Pittsburgh, not Boston.  Martinis have been hit-or-miss; they've done an excellent job on the dirty Ketel One, but some of the girls have gotten foo-foo drinks that have been undrinkable.

I went to olive or twist after my graduation, so we arrived somewhat late in the evening.  As the name suggests, they are known for their martinis.  With about 2 dozen on the menu, it was hard to choose which one to get, but I went with el jardin and then the dark knight.  Both were delicious (and actually my first two martinis).  We all passed around our martinis and each one was better than the last.  For food, we started with the nachos and calamari.  The nachos were nothing to write home about (pun intended), but the calamari was more than just fried.  It had a sweet glaze on it that tasted almost like maple syrup, but not that sweet.  Really delicious and an interesting take on an appetizer that is usually just fried and served.  For the entrée, I got the delmonico steak.  It was tasty, but not hot when it was served.  In fact, my grandfather got the same thing and he asked them to heat his up and it came back exactly the same.  The server was very polite and made it clear that he told the chef to heat it up, but i don't how on earth a chef can get that feedback and send out the same exact thing.  After a second time of asking to heat it up, it finally was hot when served.  All in all it was an interesting restaurant and definitely a good place for a drink or two if your downtown in the area.

Of all the bars in the Cultural District this one is just average. It's definitely above average on the nights that local singer Katie Simone is performing but other than that I can take it or leave it. They get busy during theatre and sports events and the crowd seems to primarily be suburbanites and yinzers.

The twist is that this place has much more to offer than just drinks!  The ambiance is great for either a happy hour, pre-performance drink/dinner or night out.  There's a small restaurant set up downstairs and then upstairs has a really hip lounge feel.  The tomato bisque is beyond amazing and the desserts are decadent.  But since they have it in the name, the martini list is fantastic, not to mention tastes great!

Olive and Twist is a convenient and rather nice bar to visit if you're staying in the downtown area.  The huge beer list and so so martinis do their job well in attracting the suits and theater crowds in mass numbers.  Finding a seat can be a chore if you come at the wrong hour because no one ever leaves!  The food menu is your typical bar menu and is very well priced.  My party only got the nachos which were good.  Our bartender, Rosie, was a sweetie and really made us feel welcomed in this steely town.

I had lunch here yesterday before the Pirates game with a few friends.  I have also been here a few times upstairs.  I really liked the fact that we had no problem getting a seat at the bar or a table.  I usually go to the bars on the North Shore prior to Pirates game, but this was a lot less crowded and good for the group I was with.  In fact, truth be told the place was only about 1/2 full (on Bucs opening day!?).  The food was okay.  I tried these nachos which were good and interesting because it had a decent quality sausage as the meat and not just ground beef.  I also really liked the sweet potato fries.  They were delicious and you usually can't get these at too many places.  I ordered the lobster roll.  It was a ton of lobster, however some of the lobster was a little overcooked and it was ice cold.  I can understand serving cool even though Id prefer warm, but ice cold really wasn't that good when they put warm butter on it.  I also tried the tortilla soup, which was really rich and had a good spicy flavor.  The only thing missing in the tortilla soup was the tortilla chips.  A minor oversight I imagine.  Overall, a pretty decent place when you are looking to just have a few beers with friends.  I've also tried the upstairs bar which is the more upscale section.  The bar is huge which is good plenty of room, and their is plenty of seating including leather couches.  The happy hour is okay, but it's pretty much a ghosttown after 8 PM.  Overall a decent place for quiet drinks without the crowds and a little better than average food.

Literally the best meal I've ever eaten great salads w homemade croutons and dressings that are to die for. Tried 3 different martinis all were good but the cookie dough martini is flawless hands down best martini ibe ever had and we love martinis!! The lobster Mac and cheese was perfect along w our service! I'd give it ten stars if I could

We were visiting Pittsburgh and after having dinner we headed to Olive or Twist to have a drink.  This was our first time there.  We sat at the bar which was definitely comfortable and the entire place had a relaxing atmosphere.  Since they have a large selection of martinis and other mixed drinks, we each tried a martini.  Who knew the drinks would be so good!  Well, one turned in to a few!  These cocktails were some of the best we've had in years...well balanced, clean, and refreshing.  Not only can Lindsay make really good drinks,  but she was able to suggest drinks when we gave her our tastes, and she enjoyable to talk to.  Next time we are visiting Pittsburgh we'll be going back...and have some food with the great drinks.  But, beware:  when you go there you may end up being responsible for the entry door...a small task we'll be happy to do.

My husband and I selected Olive or Twist for our intimate wedding reception of 85 guests. We could not be happier with our choice, and our guests raved about the food, beverages, service and ambiance. Several described it as the "most hip" wedding reception they had attended.  We reserved the entire second floor for our event, and the space was perfect. There was enough seating that no one seemed to be without an option, and the setup was cozy and intimate. Our families were able to sit in medium to large groups together, with smaller high tops for two available as well. The VIP area was used for food setup. We did not need to provide decorations - the atmosphere is already perfect and the tables really do not allow for much additional adornment.  There was enough space to allow for dancing, and ample space for coats. The back bar was used for our dessert/cookies and they added a table at the entrance for our gifts, cards, and guest book.  We chose a variety of cold/hot appetizers and penne pasta, sliders, and truffle fries as our main dishes. Everything was served on small plates. The food was incredible, and the wait staff were attentive and abundant. There was a great selection of draft and bottled beer, and numerous martini options within our price range. We selected the S'mores Martini as our signature drink (we love to camp) and it was very well-received. The General Manager, Brandon, was so responsive and incredibly helpful throughout the entire process. We were able to plan the entire event via email which was super convenient. When I selected certain menu items that he did not feel would be the best options, he pointed me in the direction of others (without inflating our bill). The portioning was right on and there were no surprises at the end of the evening.  If you are looking to host a non-traditional wedding reception (we did not have a DJ - we brought our own iPod) and are ok with unassigned seating and a more relaxed cocktail party feel, this is a perfect choice - especially for smaller receptions. Most other options in the city came with food and beverage minimums that would not have been achievable with our small number of guests.  We are so happy we decided on Olive or Twist for our wedding and would do it again in a heartbeat.
A beautiful little bar with an exciting "martini" list - do step outside your comfort zone and try one of the crafted drinks.

Olive or Twist, a narrow bar tucked away in the Cultural District, has friendly service, reasonable prices, and pretty decent bar food.  While it's not a sports bar per se, it's a great place to watch a game... like Game 7 of the Stanley Cup.  Go Pens!!  If they renovated their bathrooms, they would definitely deserve a five-star rating.
